title: Complete Monster Bestiary & Strategy
author: WTHHHELL BRO Wiki
description: A comprehensive guide to every entity in the sewers, from the Pit Maw to the deadly Bloomaw.

content.text: Appears as an innocent black cat but transforms into a violent monster. It jumps on the closest person. Counter: Flash your light on it immediately to stop the attack. Found after Floor 6.
A stationary trap monster emerging from the floor. Deals 30 damage and stuns. Counter: Drop a large item into its mouth or hit it with a Baseball Bat/Shotgun.
Deals 40 damage instantly if it spots you. Strategy: Stare at it continuously to stun it. Do not break line of sight or it will charge.
Disguises itself as another player. If you get too close, it attacks (20 dmg). Strategy: Keep distance. If it wanders aimlessly, it's likely a mimic.
Hides as a fridge. Deals 20 damage when opened from the front. Strategy: Always open fridges from the side.

title: Class Unlock Requirements
author: Delivery Goblin
description: How to unlock the Baseballer, Porter, and Veteran classes.

content.text: Requirement: Deal 1000 damage with a baseball bat and pay $12,000 coins. Bonus: Starts with a Baseball Bat.
Requirement: Move 3500 feet total distance and pay $30,000 coins. Passive: Likely increased carrying capacity or speed.
A high-tier class associated with the Shotgun. Requires significant gameplay progression and currency to unlock.

title: Beginner's Survival Guide
author: Wiki Team
description: Understanding the Elevator system, Money Bar, and Extraction.

content.text: Your goal is to scavenge food items to fill the 'Money Bar' at the top of the screen. Once full, return to the elevator.
At the elevator, the team votes. 'Deep' takes you to a harder, deeper level with better loot. 'Evacuate' ends the run and banks your cash.
You have limited slots (4). You must frequently return to the elevator to drop off items. If you die, you are evacuated but keep your items.
